title: How to Cook Lamb

methods.name: Roasted Lamb with Garlic and Rosemary

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (204 degrees C).
steps.description: In a small bowl, combine the lemon juice, rosemary, garlic, salt, and pepper. Mix the ingredients together.

steps.headline: Rub the mixture over the surface of the meat.
steps.description: Place the lamb in a baking dish and roast it in the oven for 30 minutes.

steps.headline: Reduce the oven temperature to 350 degrees F (176 degrees C).
steps.description: Continue to cook the lamb for an additional hour (meat will be medium-rare). Allow the meat to rest for 10-15 minutes before carving and serving.

steps.headline: Make the sauce.
steps.description: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat, and then add the herbs, onions, and pan drippings. Mix in the chicken stock and wine, and continue to heat the ingredients until a sauce has formed. Scrape the bottom of the pan occasionally with a wooden spoon.

steps.headline: Slice up the lamb and transfer it to a serving dish.
steps.description: Drizzle the herb sauce on top and enjoy!

steps.headline: Combine the lamb and white wine in a medium-sized bowl.
steps.description: Add in the garlic cloves and rosemary, and then let the meat marinate for 2-3 hours.

steps.headline: Remove the lamb from the marinade and pat it dry.
steps.description: Heat the olive oil in a large, thick-bottomed pan over medium-high heat. Add the meat and cook until browned on each side (about 10 minutes total), adding salt as it cooks. Cook the meat in a single layer, doing one batch at a time.

steps.headline: Transfer the meat to a separate dish and set aside.
steps.description: Add the onions to the pan and cook for about 5 minutes, or until the onions are soft and golden brown. Mix in the garlic and cook for an additional minute. Scrape the bottom of the pan occasionally with a wooden spoon.

steps.headline: Add the meat, roasted peppers, tomatoes, bay leaf, parsley, and red wine to the pan and bring the mixture to a boil.
steps.description: Reduce the heat to medium and simmer, uncovered, for about 15 minutes.

steps.headline: Pour in the chicken stock and bring the mixture to a boil again.
steps.description: Reduce the heat to low and simmer, covered, for 2 to 2 1/2 hours. Meat should be very tender when finished.

steps.headline: Serve the stew warm, adding salt and pepper to taste.

methods.name: Braised Lamb Shanks with Carrots and Potatoes

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (176 degrees C).
steps.description: Heat olive oil in a large, thick-bottomed pan over medium-high heat.

steps.headline: Sprinkle the lamb shanks with salt and place them in the pot.
steps.description: Cook the meat on all sides until browned, and then transfer the shanks to a separate dish.

steps.headline: Combine the onions, carrots, and celery in the pot.
steps.description: Sauté the vegetables for about 5 minutes, stirring often, and then add the potatoes. Cook for an additional 2 minutes.

steps.headline: Return the lamb shanks to the pot along with the garlic and herbs.
steps.description: Add the stock and bring it to a simmer.

steps.headline: Remove the pot from heat, cover it with a lid, and bake it in the oven for 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
steps.description: The meat should be tender when finished.

steps.headline: Remove the lamb shanks from the pan.
steps.description: Separate the meat from the bones, and then return the meat to the pan.

text: Roasted Lamb with Garlic and Rosemary Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (204 degrees C). In a small bowl, combine the lemon juice, rosemary, garlic, salt, and pepper. Mix the ingredients together. Rub the mixture over the surface of the meat. Place the lamb in a baking dish and roast it in the oven for 30 minutes. Reduce the oven temperature to 350 degrees F (176 degrees C). Continue to cook the lamb for an additional hour (meat will be medium-rare). Allow the meat to rest for 10-15 minutes before carving and serving. Make the sauce. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat, and then add the herbs, onions, and pan drippings. Mix in the chicken stock and wine, and continue to heat the ingredients until a sauce has formed. Scrape the bottom of the pan occasionally with a wooden spoon. Slice up the lamb and transfer it to a serving dish. Drizzle the herb sauce on top and enjoy! Traditional Basque Lamb Stew Combine the lamb and white wine in a medium-sized bowl. Add in the garlic cloves and rosemary, and then let the meat marinate for 2-3 hours. Remove the lamb from the marinade and pat it dry. Heat the olive oil in a large, thick-bottomed pan over medium-high heat. Add the meat and cook until browned on each side (about 10 minutes total), adding salt as it cooks. Cook the meat in a single layer, doing one batch at a time. Transfer the meat to a separate dish and set aside. Add the onions to the pan and cook for about 5 minutes, or until the onions are soft and golden brown. Mix in the garlic and cook for an additional minute. Scrape the bottom of the pan occasionally with a wooden spoon. Add the meat, roasted peppers, tomatoes, bay leaf, parsley, and red wine to the pan and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer, uncovered, for about 15 minutes. Pour in the chicken stock and bring the mixture to a boil again. Reduce the heat to low and simmer, covered, for 2 to 2 1/2 hours. Meat should be very tender when finished. Serve the stew warm, adding salt and pepper to taste.  Braised Lamb Shanks with Carrots and Potatoes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (176 degrees C). Heat olive oil in a large, thick-bottomed pan over medium-high heat. Sprinkle the lamb shanks with salt and place them in the pot. Cook the meat on all sides until browned, and then transfer the shanks to a separate dish. Combine the onions, carrots, and celery in the pot. Sauté the vegetables for about 5 minutes, stirring often, and then add the potatoes. Cook for an additional 2 minutes. Return the lamb shanks to the pot along with the garlic and herbs. Add the stock and bring it to a simmer. Remove the pot from heat, cover it with a lid, and bake it in the oven for 1 1/2 to 2 hours. The meat should be tender when finished. Remove the lamb shanks from the pan. Separate the meat from the bones, and then return the meat to the pan. Serve warm. Garnish with parsley if desired.

In a small bowl, combine the lemon juice, rosemary, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Mix the ingredients together.
Rub the mixture over the surface of the meat.
Place the lamb in a baking dish and roast it in the oven for 30 minutes.
Reduce the oven temperature to 350 degrees F (176 degrees C).

Traditional Basque Lamb Stew Combine the lamb and white wine in a medium-sized bowl.
Add in the garlic cloves and rosemary, and then let the meat marinate for 2-3 hours.
Remove the lamb from the marinade and pat it dry.
Heat the olive oil in a large, thick-bottomed pan over medium-high heat.
Add the meat and cook until browned on each side (about 10 minutes total), adding salt as it cooks.
Cook the meat in a single layer, doing one batch at a time.
Transfer the meat to a separate dish and set aside.
Add the onions to the pan and cook for about 5 minutes, or until the onions are soft and golden brown.
Mix in the garlic and cook for an additional minute.
Scrape the bottom of the pan occasionally with a wooden spoon.
Add the meat, roasted peppers, tomatoes, bay leaf, parsley, and red wine to the pan and bring the mixture to a boil.
Reduce the heat to medium and simmer, uncovered, for about 15 minutes.
Pour in the chicken stock and bring the mixture to a boil again.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer, covered, for 2 to 2 1/2 hours.
Meat should be very tender when finished.
Serve the stew warm, adding salt and pepper to taste.
Braised Lamb Shanks with Carrots and Potatoes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (176 degrees C).
Heat olive oil in a large, thick-bottomed pan over medium-high heat.
Sprinkle the lamb shanks with salt and place them in the pot.
Cook the meat on all sides until browned, and then transfer the shanks to a separate dish.
Combine the onions, carrots, and celery in the pot.
Sauté the vegetables for about 5 minutes, stirring often, and then add the potatoes.
Cook for an additional 2 minutes.
Return the lamb shanks to the pot along with the garlic and herbs.
Add the stock and bring it to a simmer.
Remove the pot from heat, cover it with a lid, and bake it in the oven for 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
The meat should be tender when finished.
Remove the lamb shanks from the pan.
Separate the meat from the bones, and then return the meat to the pan.
Serve warm.
Garnish with parsley if desired.
